intro: Cissampelos pareira subvar. madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar moon vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its ornamental value is appreciated in horticulture due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
